text: José Luis Rondo Polo (born 19 March 1976) is an Equatoguinean retired footballer. He started his career as a forward, subsequently moving to right winger and finally right back. He spent his entire career in his native Spain, representing five clubs at the professional level. During six years, Rondo was an Equatorial Guinea international. ==Club career== Rondo was born in Palma, Majorca, Balearic Islands. An unsuccessful RCD Mallorca youth graduate – he could only appear for their reserves – he would manage to spend seven seasons in the second division, with Getafe CF, Elche CF and UD Vecindario; his first experience at that level was precisely with Mallorca B, in 1998–99 (31 matches played, team relegation). After a one-year spell with CD Constancia (division four, also in Majorca), Rondo signed with neighbours CE Andratx of the same tier. ==International career== Spanish-born, Rondo would however represent the land of one of his parents, Equatorial Guinea, in the molds of several players whom played in Spain: Javier Balboa, Rodolfo Bodipo, Benjamín Zarandona, etc. ==References== ==External links== * * * Category:1976 births Category:Living people Category:Spanish people of Equatoguinean descent Category:Citizens of Equatorial Guinea through descent Category:Equatoguinean people of Spanish descent Category:Sportspeople from Palma de Mallorca Category:Spanish footballers Category:Equatoguinean footballers Category:Balearic footballers Category:Association football defenders Category:Segunda División players Category:Segunda División B players Category:Tercera División players Category:Divisiones Regionales de Fútbol players Category:RCD Mallorca B players Category:Getafe CF footballers Category:Elche CF players Category:CD Castellón footballers Category:Algeciras CF footballers Category:UD Vecindario players Category:CE Constància players Category:Equatorial Guinea international footballers
title: José Luis Rondo
